alert.note: Alert for West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 3:53AM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 50 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Cascade mountains of Pierce and Lewis Counties, including the Crystal Mountain Ski Area and Paradise on Mount Rainier. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief break in snowfall is possible Monday night as snow levels rise closer to 4500 feet, but snowfall will quickly return in earnest Tuesday morning as snow levels drop back closer to 2000 feet.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes
